t: Luke 7
Jesus Heals a Centurion’s Servant
When*p He had completed all His discourse in the hearing of the people, He went to Capernaum.
And*p a centurion’s slave, who was highly regarded by him, was sick and about to die.
When he heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders asking Him to come and save the life of his slave.
When they came to Jesus, they earnestly implored Him, saying, “He is worthy for You to grant this to him;
for he loves our nation and it was he who built us our synagogue.”

Now Jesus started*i on His way with them; and when He was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying to Him, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself further, for I am not worthy for You to come under my roof;
for this reason I did not even consider myself worthy to come to You, but just*i say the word, and my servant will be healed.
For I also am a man placed under authority, with soldiers under me; and I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
Now when Jesus heard this, He marveled at him, and turned and said to the crowd that was following Him, “I*r say*r to*r you,*r not*r even*r in*r Israel*r have*r I*r found*r such*r great*r faith.”*r
When those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the slave in good health.
Soon*p afterwards He went to a city called Nain; and His disciples were going along with Him, accompanied by a large crowd.
Now as He approached the gate of the city, a dead man was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow; and a sizeable crowd from the city was with her.
When the Lord saw her, He felt compassion for her, and said to her, “Do*r not*r weep.”*r
And He came up and touched the coffin; and the bearers came to a halt. And He said, “Young*r man,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r arise!”*r
The dead man sat up and began to speak. And Jesus*i gave him back to his mother.
Fear gripped them all, and they began*i glorifying God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited His people!”
This report concerning Him went out all over Judea and in all the surrounding district.
A Deputation from John
The*p disciples of John reported to him about all these things.
Summoning two of his disciples, John sent them to the Lord, saying, “Are You the Expected One, or do we look for someone else?”
When the men came to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, to ask, ‘Are You the Expected One, or do we look for someone else?’ ”
At that very time He cured many people*i of diseases and afflictions and evil spirits; and He gave sight to many who*i were*i blind.

And He answered and said to them, “Go*r and*r report*r to*r John*r what*r you*r have*r seen*r and*r heard:*r the*ir blind*sr receive*sr sight,*sr the*ir lame*r walk,*r the*ir lepers*r are*r cleansed,*r and*r the*ir deaf*r hear,*r the*ir dead*r are*r raised*r up,*r the*ir poor*sr have*sr the*sr gospel*sr preached*sr to*sr them.*sr
Blessed*r is*r he*r who*r does*r not*r take*r offense*r at*r Me.”*r
When*p the messengers of John had left, He began to speak to the crowds about John, “What*r did*r you*r go*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r shaken*r by*r the*r wind?*r

But*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r dressed*r in*r soft*r clothing?*r Those*r who*r are*r splendidly*r clothed*r and*r live*r in*r luxury*r are*r found*ir in*r royal*r palaces!*r
But*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yes,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r and*r one*r who*r is*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
This*r is*r the*r one*r about*r whom*r it*r is*r written,*r ‘Behold,*srpn I*r send*sr My*sr messenger*sr ahead*sr of*sr You,*sr Who*srln will*sr prepare*sr Your*sr way*sr before*sr You.’*sr
I*rp say*r to*r you,*r among*r those*r born*r of*r women*r there*r is*r no*r one*r greater*r than*r John;*r yet*r he*r who*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r greater*r than*r he.”*r
When all the people and the tax collectors heard this,*i they acknowledged God’s justice, having been baptized with the baptism of John.
But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected God’s purpose for themselves, not having been baptized by John.
“To*rp what*r then*r shall*r I*r compare*r the*r men*r of*r this*r generation,*r and*r what*r are*r they*r like?*r

They*r are*r like*r children*r who*r sit*r in*r the*r market*r place*r and*r call*r to*r one*r another,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘We*r played*r the*r flute*r for*r you,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r dance;*r we*r sang*r a*r dirge,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r weep.’*r
For*r John*r the*r Baptist*r has*r come*r eating*r no*r bread*r and*r drinking*r no*r wine,*r and*r you*r say,*r ‘He*r has*r a*r demon!’*r
The*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r come*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r and*r you*r say,*r ‘Behold,*r a*r gluttonous*r man*r and*r a*r drunkard,*r a*r friend*r of*r tax*r collectors*r and*r sinners!’*r
Yet*r wisdom*r is*r vindicated*r by*r all*r her*r children.”*r
Now*p one of the Pharisees was requesting Him to dine with him, and He entered the Pharisee’s house and reclined at*i the*i table.*i
And there was a woman in the city who was a sinner; and when she learned that He was reclining at*i the*i table*i in the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster vial of perfume,
and standing behind Him*i at His feet, weeping, she began to wet His feet with her tears, and kept wiping them with the hair of her head, and kissing His feet and anointing them with the perfume.
Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet He would know who and what sort of person this woman is who is touching Him, that she is a sinner.”
Parable of Two Debtors
And*p Jesus answered him, “Simon,*r I*r have*r something*r to*r say*r to*r you.”*r And he replied, “Say it, Teacher.”
“A*r moneylender*r had*r two*r debtors:*r one*r owed*r five*r hundred*r denarii,*r and*r the*r other*r fifty.*r
When*r they*r were*r unable*r to*r repay,*r he*r graciously*r forgave*r them*r both.*r So*r which*r of*r them*r will*r love*r him*r more?”*r
Simon answered and said, “I suppose the one whom he forgave more.” And He said to him, “You*r have*r judged*r correctly.”*r

Turning toward the woman, He said to Simon, “Do*r you*r see*r this*r woman?*r I*r entered*r your*r house;*r you*r gave*r Me*r no*r water*r for*r My*r feet,*r but*r she*r has*r wet*r My*r feet*r with*r her*r tears*r and*r wiped*r them*r with*r her*r hair.*r
You*r gave*r Me*r no*r kiss;*r but*r she,*r since*r the*r time*r I*r came*r in,*r has*r not*r ceased*r to*r kiss*r My*r feet.*r
You*r did*r not*r anoint*r My*r head*r with*r oil,*r but*r she*r anointed*r My*r feet*r with*r perfume.*r
For*r this*r reason*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r her*r sins,*r which*r are*r many,*r have*r been*r forgiven,*r for*r she*r loved*r much;*r but*r he*r who*r is*r forgiven*r little,*r loves*r little.”*r
Then He said to her, “Your*r sins*r have*r been*r forgiven.”*r
Those who were reclining at*i the*i table*i with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is this man*i who even forgives sins?”
And He said to the woman, “Your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you;*r go*r in*r peace.”*r
